p: The first international policy framework in DRR, the Hyogo Framework for Action 2005 – 2015 (HFA), made little reference to health [ 16, 19, 40]. However, the Sendai Framework for Disaster Risk Reduction 2015 – 2030, which superseded the HFA, recognised health as a key contributor to, and beneficiary of, DRR [ 13, 18]. It did so through numerous direct references to health, the expansion of the definition of disasters to include those caused by health-specific hazards (e.g., biological hazards and epidemics), direct reference to the International Health Regulations, and the recognition of health as a cross-cutting issue captured within five of the seven global DRR targets [ 13, 14, 16, 18, 27, 40, 64, 65].
